DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

Capacity: 36

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date, Youth A was hit by Staff 1.
On an unknown date, Staff 1 and Youth C were in a vehicle and
Staff 1 slapped Youth C's hand when they tried to change the
radio. Staff 1 has hit and pushed the youth on other occasions.
Investigation Interviews:
Therapist was interviewed via phone on October 10, 2025.
Therapist reported during her therapy session with Youth A, Youth
A reported Staff 1 had hit her. She reported Youth A would not
disclose any other information. Therapist confirmed she also
works with Youth C, and Youth C has never disclosed any
concerns about Staff 1 to her. She reported she has worked with
Staff 1 and has not observed any concern regarding Staff 1’s
interactions with the youth at the facility. Therapist reported Staff 1
is a staff member who makes sure everyone is following the rules
and expectations at the facility, which sometimes can make the
youth upset because they do not want to be held accountable for
their actions.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on October 10, 2025. Staff 3
reported she was talking with Youth C about something when she
randomly brought up a concern that Staff 1 had slapped her in the
car. She reported Youth C stated Youth C was in the car with
Youth A and Staff 1 was driving. Staff 3 reported Youth C stated
when she went to adjust the volume on the radio, Staff 1 slapped
her hand to make her stop. Staff 3 reported Youth C also
disclosed there was another time when Staff 1 pushed and hit her,
but she would not disclose any more information about this. She
reported Youth C stated Youth A encouraged her to report her
concerns about Staff 1 to an adult. Staff 3 reported she does work
with Staff 1, so she cannot attest to Staff 1’s behavior around the
2

youth. She reported staff at the facility are trained to never slap,
hit, or push a youth, even if it meant to be in a manner of playing
around with the youth.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
October 9, 2025 and October 16, 2025. Youth A reported she
does not like living at the facility and wants to go home. She
reported she does not like working with any of the staff on her unit.
Youth A reported she does find comfort in doing check-ins with the
supervisors at the other units at the facility. When asked to explain
more about why she does not like the staff on her unit, she
reported she feels the staff are always redirecting her and are
quick to give a consequence. Youth A then reported that, one of
the main staff she does not like, is Staff 1. She reported she does
not like Staff 1 because she is always in her business, and she
has snatched things out of Youth A’s hand. When asked to explain
more about Staff 1 snatching an item out of Youth A’s hand, Youth
A reported she had an item in her hand she was not supposed to
have, she believed it was a food item, and Staff 1 continued to tell
Youth A she needed to put it away. Youth A reported she did not
follow the redirection, so Staff 1 snatched the food item out of her
hand and slapped the top of Youth A's hand with her own hand.
She reported she did not like this and felt it was wrong of her to do
so. Youth A could not remember when this event occurred. She
reported she does not believe there was any other staff or youth
around when it happened. Youth A reported she did not make this
complaint to get Staff 1 fired, but because she was frustrated
about the way Staff 1 was treating her. She reported there was
another incident with Staff 1 not treating another youth well in the
car. Youth A was asked to talk more about the incident. She
reported she was in the car when it happened, but she did not
want to speak about the situation because she was not the youth
involved. Youth A refused to provide information about when this
occurred or who was involved in that situation. Consultant
attempted to talk with Youth A again on October 16, 2025, but
Youth A did not want to meet.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
October 16, 2025. Youth C reported she feels safe at the facility
and gets along with most of the staff. She reported she does not
like Staff 1. When asked to explain more, Youth C reported she
does not like Staff 1 because she is always in her business and
does not give her space when she requests it. She reported Youth
A encouraged her to bring up her concerns about Staff 1. Youth C
reported she told Staff 3 about her concerns after she talked with
Youth A about Staff 1. When asked to explain more about what
3

she told Staff 3, Youth C reported there was a time when she was
in the agency car with Staff 1 and Youth A. Youth C could not
remember exactly where they were going or on what date this
occurred. She reported Youth A encouraged her to turn up the
volume on the radio as Youth C was in the front seat. Youth C
reported when she turned up the volume, Staff 1 told her it was
too loud, and she slapped the top of Youth C’s hand when it was
still on the volume control button. She reported she was taken
aback by that action as it reminded her of the abuse she had gone
through prior to coming to the facility. Youth C denied any other
times that she was harmed by Staff 1.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on October
9, 2025, and on October 16, 2025. Staff 1 reported she is a new
staff member at the facility, and she is still getting to know how to
do her job. She reported she feels like things are going well, but
sometimes the youth do not like her because she holds them
accountable. When asked about her relationship with Youth A,
Staff 1 reported she has a positive relationship with Youth A until
Staff 1 has to enforce a rule with Youth A. She reported Youth A
will continue to yell at her when she does not get her way. Staff 1
denied ever hitting or slapping any of the youth at the facility,
including Youth A. She reported staff are not allowed to put their
hands on a youth unless they are going into an approved restraint
hold for an emergency reason. When asked about taking an item
out of Youth A’s hand, Staff 1 reported Youth A had a food item in
a bag that she was not allowed to have at that moment. She
reported she encouraged Youth A to make the right choice and
put the item away. Staff 1 reported she had asked Youth A for the
item numerous times, and Youth A began to get upset over this.
She reported Youth A stuck out her hand with the item in the bag,
and Staff 1 then took the bag out of Youth A’s hand. She denied
ever touching Youth A and only touching the bag. Staff 1 denied
ever slapping Youth A’s hand after grabbing the bag. She could
not remember specifically when this happened but confirms there
were no other youth or staff around when it occurred. Staff 1
reported in the future; she won’t take anything out of her hand and
will allow her to place it on the table instead. Staff 1 was asked if
she had driven Youth A and Youth C within the agency vehicle,
which she confirmed she had at least three to four times. She
denied there ever being any concerns during these drives. When
asked if there was ever an issue with Youth C turning up the
volume on the radio, Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth C like to
have the music up loud, and she will have to, at times, turn down
the radio. She reported she will talk with the youth about the
concerns of the volume being too high and they can come to an
4

agreement on a volume level. Staff 1 denied she ever slapped
Youth C’s hand away from the radio.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
October 9, 2025 and October 16, 2025. Supervisor reported
Staff 1 is a newer employee at the facility. She reported she has
not heard of any concerns of Staff 1 slapping, pushing, or hitting a
youth at the facility. Supervisor reported she is constantly doing
individual private check-ins with the youth about how things are
going at the facility, and she has never heard of these concerns.
She reported some of the youth do not like Staff 1 because she
holds the youth accountable for their actions and will redirect the
youth more to do the right thing. Supervisor reported Youth A
does not do well when it comes to accountability and redirections.
When asked about the incident with Youth C and Staff 1 in the
car, Supervisor reported she had never heard about this concern
until Youth C disclosed it to Staff 3. She reported Youth A did
encourage Youth C to speak up about the situation, which was
interesting as Youth A and Youth C typically do not get along with
one another. Supervisor reported Youth C is typically the first
youth to report a concern that happens at the facility.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
October 9, 2025. Youth B reported things are going well at the
facility. She reported the staff treat her well at the facility. Youth B
reported she likes Staff 1 and noted that Staff 1 is always in a
positive mood, which can make Youth B feel annoyed. She denied
ever seeing or hearing about Staff 1 hitting or slapping another
youth. Youth B reported she has never seen Staff 1 snatch any
items out of the youth’s hands.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on October
9, 2025. Staff 2 reported she has worked with Staff 1. She denied
ever seeing Staff 1 having a negative interaction with the youth.
Staff 2 reported the only negative feedback she has heard from
the youth about Staff 1 is that Staff 1 is too happy. She reported
she has never heard or seen Staff 1 hit or slap a youth at the
facility. Staff 2 reported she has never seen Staff 1 snatch an item
out of a youth’s hand. She reported staff are to encourage the
youth to give up the item if they are not supposed to have it and
try to limit a power struggle with the youth.
Documents Reviewed:
- Facility’s Prohibited Interventions policy dated
09/10/2025- The policy noted that any corporal or physical
punishment including hitting, striking, throwing, kicking,
5

pulling, pushing, spanking, pinching, slapping, hair pulling,
pressure points, mouth washing, sitting or standing in a
specific position, strenuous physical exercise or threatening
to use any of these methods are strictly prohibited.
- Facility Incident Reports- There were no incident reports
listed that involved concerns between Youth A or Youth C
with Staff 1.
- Human Resource File for Staff 1- Staff 1 has only been
employed at the facility for a little over a month. There are
no disciplinary actions noted within her file. Staff 1 is up to
date on all required training, including a review of all
internal policies and restraint model training which was all
completed by 09/23/2025.
- Email with Law Enforcement dated 10/10/2025- Due to
the limited information, Law Enforcement confirmed a
criminal case was not going to be opened.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as there was not enough
information to support a rule violation. This is due to Staff 1
denying ever slapping either Youth A or Youth C. Youth A could
not give specifics of when Staff 1 slapped her hand and noted that
there was no one else around. Youth C could not give specifics of
when Staff 1 slapped her hand in the car and Youth A would not
report what she saw in the car that day. Youth B reported she has
never seen Staff 1 slap any of the youth. Therapist, Staff 2, and
Supervisor reported they have never seen or heard of Staff 1
causing physical harm to any of the youth at the facility.
Technical Assistance
This consultant provided technical assistance to Supervisor to
increase check in’s and training support to Staff 1 as she is a
newer staff member at the facility and there were some areas of
growth noted within interviews that Staff 1 could benefit from.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
10/24/2025
